mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>20 Mar 2016:
The Final Exam key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-final-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span
style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>  </span></span></span><![endif]><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>11 Mar 2016:</span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> The Monster Sudoku Final Report Template has been
revised to clarify the distinction between <span class=SpellE><b><u>completable</u></b></span>
and <b><u>solvable</u></b>, and the new version is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/monster-sudoku-final-report-template_rev1_20160310.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>10Mar2016: The Quiz #4 answer key has been posted
below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-quiz-4-key.pdf">here</a>.</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>10Mar2016: Google's <span class=SpellE>AlphaGo</span>
has won the first two games of a 5-game $1M Go match in Korea against Lee <span
class=SpellE>Sedol</span> (9-dan pro), the top Go player of the past decade. <br>
<a href="https://gogameguru.com/alphago-2/">https://gogameguru.com/alphago-2/</a>
<br>
<a
href="http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/go-match-between-lee-sedol-alphago-push-ai-boundaries-n533821">http://www.nbcnews.com/tech/tech-news/go-match-between-lee-sedol-alphago-push-ai-boundaries-n533821</a>
<br>
<a
href="http://www.wired.com/2016/03/googles-ai-wins-first-game-historic-match-go-champion/">http://www.wired.com/2016/03/googles-ai-wins-first-game-historic-match-go-champion/</a>
<br>
<a href="https://deepmind.com/alpha-go.html">https://deepmind.com/alpha-go.html</a>
<br>
You are watching AI history being made before your eyes.  Go was the last
major board game at which human champions could beat computers.  It was
widely believed to be at least a decade before a computer could beat the human
champion.</span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>10Mar2016: In response to student feedback and
requests:</span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(1)
The Final Report deadline is extended to Wednesday, 16 Mar, 11:59pm.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(2)
We realize that some student projects have difficulty in scaling to N>9, so
for them we will put less grading weight on Parts 4&5.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Student projects that do scale well to
N>9 may get extra credit, at our sole discretion.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>(3)
If you are unable to solve “hard” puzzles at N=9 and so cannot do
Parts 2-4, then use N=8 or N=6 in Part 2 and work up from there doing the best
you can. Please be sure to notate this exception in your comments.</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>3 Mar 2016: The Monster Sudoku Final Report Template
has been posted below and is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/monster-sudoku-final-report-template_rev1_20160303.pdf">here</a>.</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>1 Mar 2016:
The tester program has been removed because it has been replaced by the grader
program. Teams that deposit their code in EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>
by midnight, Friday, 4 March, will have their code run through the grader
program and be notified of any errors by Saturday morning. Contact the TA, <span
class=SpellE>Junkyu</span> Lee, with any questions.</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>25Feb2016:
The Quiz #3 answer key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-quiz-3-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>16Feb2016:
The Project deadlines have been extended to give you more time to code. <span
style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>(1)</span> The Forward Checking
deadline has been extended to next Sunday, 21 Feb, <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>and will be regraded.</u></b> Please fix any problems with your code
and resubmit if needed. <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>(2)</span>
The AC-3/ACP/MAC part has been made <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>optional
for extra credit</u></b>. <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>(3)</span>
The MRV/DH part has been extended to Sunday, 6 March, and combined with the LCV
deadline.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>11Feb2016:
The Mid-term Exam key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-midterm-exam-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>11Feb2016:
Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Junkyu</span> Lee, the TA, a revised
and more detailed the Sudoku Project Assignments document is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuProjectAssignments_20160209.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>9Feb2016:
The Midterm exam will cover chapters 1-6 in your textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>9Feb2016:
Marvin Minsky, one of the early pioneers of AI, has passed away recently (e.g.,
see <a href="http://web.media.mit.edu/~minsky/">here</a> and <a
href="http://r.search.yahoo.com/_ylt=AwrTcdh2RLpW5aYAD0wnnIlQ;_ylu=X3oDMTEyZmNhYm5oBGNvbG8DZ3ExBHBvcwMyBHZ0aWQDQjE2MzhfMQRzZWMDc3I-/RV=2/RE=1455076599/RO=10/RU=https%3a%2f%2fen.wikipedia.org%2fwiki%2fMarvin_Minsky/RK=0/RS=M0WZHNu.c8w6w_0_B34bGzvm0zQ-">here</a>).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>6Feb2016:
Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, the
Reader, we have updated the Quiz #2 key to include the approximate percentage
and number of students who scored Perfect, Partial, and Zero on each question
(available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-quiz-2-key.pdf">here</a>
and in the <a href="#_Study_Guides_---">Study Guides</a> section below).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>3Feb2016:
Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, the
Reader, we have released a revised Testing Shell v.0.2 (available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuTester_v0.2.zip1">here</a>, and
also in the <a href="#_Project:_1">Project</a> section below). This testing
shell should accommodate your Sudoku solver.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><span
class=SpellE><span class=GramE>Minhaeng</span></span></span><span class=GramE> <span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>'s</span></span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'> fervent hope is that you will
discover all of the problems with the testing shell quickly, and report them to
him promptly, so that he may fix them and improve your experience.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>   </span>Please send feedback email to
minhaenl@uci.edu, and CC me when you do so.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Because
we did not provide the promised testing shell for your code prior to the due
date, and since many of your programs had problems, the CS-171 Teaching Staff
after discussion has decided to treat this assignment very gently and
charitably.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Provided that you
turned in something that was binary, source, and documentation, you will not be
penalized if your code did not work in our <span class=GramE>scripts,</span>
because it is partially our fault since you were not provided with the promised
testing shell. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>***<span
class=GramE>*<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You</span> are
responsible for fixing your code so that on the *next* assignment it runs
correctly in our scripts (= it runs correctly in the current released Testing
Shell).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Otherwise, you will lose
points on the *next* assignment.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>3Feb2016:
The answer key to Quiz #2 has been posted below and also is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-quiz-2-key.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jan2016:
Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, the
Reader, a test shell to validate your programs on <span class=SpellE>openlab</span>
is available <a href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/CS171_TestShell_0_1.zip1">here</a>.
This shell is only for testing whether student's program is runnable on the <span
class=SpellE>openlab</span> environment. Note that, currently, the testing
shell doesn't contain tests for whether or not the output is correct. We will
update later.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jan2016:
Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Junkyu</span> Lee, the TA, a
detailed description of exactly what to turn in for your Sudoku Project
Assignments is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuProjectAssignments_20160209.pdf">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It will be updated as we go along. <u>Please
note that we are still discussing what to do about the Generator portion of the
project, which was canceled (see below) because the provided Java shell
included a generator. However, apparently some students have written their own
generator anyway. Most likely we will give extra credit for extra work; but the
matter is still under discussion. In the meantime, it is OK if your program
accepts the GEN and BT option tokens, even if they do not appear in the current
description.</u><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>28Jan2016:
A former CS-171 student has shared some news that you may find of interest.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/innovations/wp/2016/01/27/google-just-mastered-a-game-thats-vexed-scientists-for-decades/?tid=sm_fb">"...
<span class=GramE>a</span> few hours ago, Google announced that one of their
DeepMind AI's, <span class=SpellE>AlphaGo</span>, was able to successfully
defeat a Go master in a game without any handicap."</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Related
links, which you may find of interest (you must access the links below from
within your UCI login or Nature may try to charge you for them):<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>Ø<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Nature
| Editorial:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://www.nature.com/news/digital-intuition-1.19230">Digital
intuition:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>A computer program that
can outplay humans in the abstract game of Go will redefine our relationship
with machines.</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>Ø<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Nature
| News:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://www.nature.com/news/google-ai-algorithm-masters-ancient-game-of-go-1.19234">Google
AI algorithm masters ancient game of Go:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Deep-learning software defeats human professional for first time.</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='margin-left:1.0in;mso-add-space:
auto;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l3 level1 lfo4'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>Ø<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Nature
| Article:<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://www.nature.com/nature/journal/v529/n7587/full/nature16961.html">Mastering
the game of Go with deep neural networks and tree search</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Every
project team, <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>including
students who code in Java,</span> must turn in the Backtracking Search
assignment by Sunday, 31 Jan. <span class=GramE>Erroneously</span>, an
announcement below (now canceled) previously said that “For students who
code in Java, *nothing* will be due on Sun., 31 Jan.” We later realized
that even students who code in Java must submit code and executables that
function correctly under our project scripts.<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>In
order to make the Project more fair to students who code in Python or C++, the
CS-171 Teaching Staff has decided to offer Extra Credit points to any student
who writes their own project shell without using or copying code from the Java
shell provided (it is OK to look at it for ideas, but not to copy it directly).
In order to be fair, this offer is available to all students, including those
who prefer to code in Java. The exact amount of Extra Credit will be decided
and posted to EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span> shortly.<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>EEE
<span class=SpellE>DropBoxes</span> for your project assignments are now
available. Please follow the file format and naming conventions stated below.<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
Syllabus part of the class website has been reorganized to be more user-friendly
and easier to navigate. For each week, material has been grouped and ordered
as: Lecture Slides, Discussion Slides, Project Deadlines, Optional Homework,
Optional Reading, and Optional Cultural Interest.<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
quiz #1 key has been posted below and is available <a
href="../cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs171-old-tests/2016-wq-cs-171-quiz-1-key.pdf">here</a>.<b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>A
description of what to turn in for your first assignment is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuProjectAssignments_20160209.pdf">here</a>.
It currently covers Backtracking Search (due Sun., 31 Jan., 11:59pm), and will
be expanded as we go along.<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><o:p></o:p></b></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><b><u><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;
color:red'>Sun., 24 Jan., 11:59pm: DEADLINE CANCELLED --- SEE CLASS EMAIL.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*NOTHING* IS DUE THIS SUN., 24 JAN.</span></u></b><b><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span><s>Project Problem Generator Deadline.</s></span></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><s><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>
You will lose 10% of your Project grade for every day it is late, pro-rated for
fractional days and rounded up to the nearest integer percentage point above.</span></s></b><b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>I
have revised the class website to cancel the Sun., Jan. 24, deadline.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The Java coding shell that was provided
has rendered the generator unnecessary, even for students who prefer C++ or
Python.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>I
am and remain embarrassed that there is a Java shell but no C++ <span
class=GramE>nor</span> Python shell (which are expected to be written this
quarter by former CS-171 students who scored A- or better).<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Nevertheless,
upon discussion, the CS-171 Teaching Staff (the TA, Reader, and I) became
worried about the possibly excessive workload if we made you code *everything*
from scratch with no guidance whatsoever.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>In
the end, our worries about a possibly excessive workload outweighed our
concerns that releasing a Java-only coding shell would favor students who
preferred Java.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It became yet
another engineering trade-off, and concerns about excessive workload became
more important.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>For
students who prefer C++ or Python, please recognize that your task has been
greatly simplified by the release of the Java shell. Even if you do not prefer
Java, surely you can read it, and porting/translating existing code is always
easier than writing it from scratch.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>***<span
class=GramE>*<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>For</span> students
who code in C++ or Python, I apologize that your ported/translated backtracking
search working code still will be due on<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Sun., 31 Jan., 11:59pm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The
reason is so that you do not fall behind in your coding project.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Your submitted code should be
essentially a port/translation of the provided Java backtracking search
shell.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I apologize that I have only
a Java shell now; but it is what I have do now, and porting/translating it will
move you greatly forward relative to the workload of coding it from scratch.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span><s>For
students who code in Java, *nothing* will be due on Sun., 31 Jan., 11:59pm,
because the shell provides it all.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please do not rest on your laurels.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Instead, please use this time to get further ahead in your project.<o:p></o:p></s></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span
style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>All
remaining Project deadlines will persist unchanged.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The TA and the Reader (<span
class=SpellE>Junkyu</span> Lee and <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee) are
in charge of the Project, and shortly will release relative weights of the
several Project components.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
CS-171 Teaching Staff discussed the Project and decided to release a Java
coding shell for Sudoku. I do not yet have C++ or Python shells (they will be
written this quarter), and it has never been tested by “live” use
in a CS-171 class. In spite of these limitations, we thought it might be
helpful to you as an example.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
CS-171 Teaching Staff discussed Project grading and decided to temper justice
with mercy. You will lose 10% of your Project grade for every day it is late,
pro-rated for fractional days and rounded up to the nearest integer percentage
point above. (Previously, you lost 10% for every day or fraction thereof that
it was late.)<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
Google form (<a href="http://goo.gl/forms/YLixJ7ep5j">http://goo.gl/forms/YLixJ7ep5j</a><span
class=GramE>)<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><u>REPLACES</u></b></span> the EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span>
that was previously mentioned.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please deposit your team information in the Google form <b
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u>AND NOT</u></b> in the EEE <span
class=SpellE>DropBox</span>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>Merged with Sudoku Project Assignments
(above).</span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'> <s>A
Specification for your Monster Sudoku problem Reader and Generator is available
here.</s> <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle style='text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l2 level1 lfo2'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-family:Wingdings;mso-fareast-font-family:Wingdings;mso-bidi-font-family:
Wingdings'><span style='mso-list:Ignore'>v<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'> 
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Please
submit your team information to the following Google form.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><a
href="http://goo.gl/forms/YLixJ7ep5j">http://goo.gl/forms/YLixJ7ep5j</a><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>1)
As announced, the submission is due by upcoming Friday, Jan 15th, 23:59 PM.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>2)
It is okay to submit your team information ONCE. <o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoListParagraphCxSpMiddle><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><u><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>NO SPACES, NOR ANY OTHER
UNIX SPECIAL CHARACTER</span></u></b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>,
in <span class=SpellE>yourTeamName</span>. They break our scripts and waste
time and effort. You may lose points if <span class=SpellE>yourTeamName</span>
breaks our scripts. You are guaranteed to be safe if <span class=SpellE>yourTeamName</span>
contains no spaces nor any other <span class=GramE>Unix</span> special
character. Letters, numbers, hyphens, and underscores are safe.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;

<h2><a name="_Goal:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Goal:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:black'>The goal of this class is to familiarize you with the basic
principles of artificial intelligence. You will l</span><span style='font-size:
12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>earn <span style='color:black'>some
</span>basic AI techniques, the problems for which they are applicable, and
their limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course content is organized roughly around what are often considered to be three
central pillars of AI: Search, Logic, and Learning. Topics covered include
basic search, heuristic search, game search, constraint satisfaction, knowledge
representation, logic and inference, probabilistic modeling, and machine
learning algorithms. <o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<div class=MsoNormal align=center style='text-align:center'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=center>

</div>

<h2><a name="_Class_Setup:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Class Setup:</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>The
course will be primarily lecture-based.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>There will be a Mid-term and a Final Exam.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On most second Tuesdays, adjusting for
the <span class=SpellE>the</span> Mid-term Exam, the first 20 minutes will be
an in-class pop quiz, followed by lecture (see specific dates in <a
href="#_Important_Dates:">Important Dates</a> above).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The frequent quizzes are intended to
encourage you to stay current with the course material.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><u>All exams and quizzes may cover all
material presented in class, including lectures and assigned textbook reading.</u><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Quizzes will cover mostly material presented
since the last quiz, and also may include questions that many students missed
on the previous quiz.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The Final
Exam will cover mostly material since the Mid-term Exam, and also will include
many questions intended to encourage you to remember the earlier material
(i.e., it <u>will </u>be comprehensive). <u>Please study the previous CS-171
quizzes and exams (<a href="#_Study_Guides_---">below</a>), which are made
available as study guides to help you learn and master the class material; they
are important guides about the performance that will be expected from you now.</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>There
will be an AI coding project (see <a href="#_Projects:">Project section</a>
below).<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are allowed to do the
project by yourself, or you may form project teams of two students following
the “<a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pair_programming">Pair
Programming</a>” paradigm.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please note that you are encouraged to discuss concepts, methods,
algorithms, etc.; but you are forbidden to copy: (1) source code from any
source, or (2) text from any source unless properly cited and set off as a
quote.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Except for class materials
provided from this class website, you must invent and write all of your own
code by yourself with your partner.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Except for properly referenced material, you must write all of your own
project report by yourself with your partner. <span style='background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Please note that your source code and project report are
subject to analysis by automated plagiarism detection programs, and that direct
copying will be treated as an act of academic dishonesty (please see the
section on “<a href="#_Academic_Honesty:">Academic Honesty</a>”
below). Please start your AI coding project earlier than you believe necessary;
it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is true of all
coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>All
my AI project shells were written by former CS-171 students who became
interested in AI and signed up for CS-199 in order to pursue their interest and
write more interesting AI project shells.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please let me know if this is of interest to you (CS-171 grade of A- or
better required).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Homework
will be assigned, but is not graded. The reason is that prior student course
evaluations alerted me to the existence of student cheating by way of copying
the homework answers.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I deplore
this degree of personal degradation in dishonest students, but I cannot control
it, and so I avoid the opportunity.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>I remain determined to create a fair and honest educational experience
for all students, as best I can.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'>

<hr size=2 width="100%" align=left>

</span></h2>

<h2><a name="_Textbook"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>Textbook</span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
color:red'>Required:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:black'><span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span><a
href="http://aima.cs.berkeley.edu/">Russell & <span class=SpellE><span
class=GramE>Norvig</span></span><span class=GramE> :</span> Artificial
Intelligence; A Modern Approach, 3<sup>rd</sup> edition.</a><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>The
course is based on, and the UCI bookstore has, the 3<sup>rd</sup> edition. The
assigned textbook reading is required, and is fair game for quizzes and
exams.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:red'>You

style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I expect that you have a personal copy
of the textbook, and quizzes and exams are written accordingly.</span></b><span
style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook for the quarter (and then resell it
back to the UCI Bookstore at the end if you don't want it for reference).</span>
<b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please do not
jeopardize your precious educational experience with the false economy of
trying to save a few dollars by not having a personal copy of the textbook.</span></b><span
style='mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style='mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:black'>Also,
for your convenience, I have requested that a copy of the textbook be placed on
reserve in the UCI Science Library.</span><strong><span style='font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'> There is a two-hour check-out limit. </span></strong>However,
please understand that with high student enrollments, it is unrealistic to
expect that these thin reserves always will be available when you need
them.  <b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='color:red'>Please
purchase or rent your own personal textbook.</span></b><strong><span
style='color:red;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

<p><strong><span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow;font-weight:
normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>I do deplore the high cost of textbooks.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>You are likely to find the book cheaper
if you search online at EBay.com, Amazon.com, and related sites.<o:p></o:p></span></strong></p>

"Times New Roman";color:red'>Every student who fills out a course evaluation
for CS-171 will receive a bonus of 1% added to their final grade, free and
clear, off the curve, simply a bonus.</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>EEE will
return to me the names of students who fill out evaluations (but not the
content, which remains anonymous), provided that enough students fill out
evaluations so that anonymity is not compromised.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>I will add 1% free bonus to the final grade
of each such named student.</span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>        </span><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Student course
evaluations are very important to me for monitoring and improving the course
content, and very important to UCI for evaluating our success at our
educational mission.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>*Please* fill
out your student course evaluations.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-.25in;mso-list:l0 level1 lfo9'><![if !supportLists]><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:Symbol;mso-fareast-font-family:Symbol;
mso-bidi-font-family:Symbol;font-weight:normal;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><span
style='mso-list:Ignore'>·<span style='font:7.0pt "Times New Roman"'>       
</span></span></span><![endif]><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman"'>“Bonus Points” will be awarded, at my sole
discretion, (1) to the first student who spots a genuine technical error (typos
don’t count) in any of the course materials before I spot it too, and (2)
for helpful contributions to the class as we go along.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>One bonus point is equivalent to one
quiz point.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Your
Bonus Points, if any, should be visible to you in EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>.
If for some reason you have been awarded a Bonus Point, but you did not get a
notification from me or it did not appear in EEE <span class=SpellE>GradeBook</span>,
please do not hesitate to send an email message to me as a reminder.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><a name="_Study_Habits:"></a><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";color:red'>Study Habits:</span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>This course is technical, rigorous,
and demanding. You will be expected to learn and master a large body of
technical material in a very short period of time. You must demonstrate your
mastery by (1) accurate performance on frequent quizzes and exams, and (2)
successful implementation of an AI coding project.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>I
deliberately treat you as adults who are responsible for your own educational
decisions, and so Lecture and Discussion Sections are optional. Nevertheless,
students who do not attend both Lecture and Discussion Sections are at a
serious disadvantage and do not succeed as well in this class.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Students who spend Lectures and
Discussion Sections sleeping, on cell phones, surfing the Web, or on social media
are wasting their time and might as well be absent.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Such students send me email messages to
ask questions that already were covered thoroughly and in detail during Lecture
and again in Discussion Section.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>On
quizzes and exams, they miss points that already have been covered thoroughly.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><u><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Your
educational moments are precious, and your education now will be the single
most important factor in your future career success or failure.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please, make the most of your precious
educational moments now. Please, attend both Lecture and Discussion Section,
pay attention, ask questions, and master the material.</span></u><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
do not ever fall behind in the class material; instead, <u>study frequently and
diligently</u>. Please begin your AI coding project earlier than you believe necessary;
it will take longer and be more difficult than you expect (<u>as is true of all
coding projects everywhere at all times</u>).<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
work harder and study longer.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Please understand thoroughly all class material, and ask questions when
you do not understand.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please
attend all lectures and discussion sections.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please come to lectures and discussion
sections prepared with questions about any material that is not clear.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please do all assigned reading, both
before and again after lecture. Please review the lecture notes, several times
over, both before and again after lecture, until you understand every detail.
Please regularly attend office hours with me and the TA. Please ask questions
about any class material that is not absolutely crystal clear.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>work and understand all past quizzes and exams; they are important guides
about the performance that will be expected from you now.</u> Please work and
understand all the optional homework.<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2><span style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman"'>Please
<u>OVERSTUDY!!</u><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt'><span
style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span></span><span
class=GramE><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>“<a
href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Technological_singularity">Technological
singularity</a>” --- Wikipedia.</span></span><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>                                    </span>“The
technological singularity hypothesis is that accelerating progress in
technologies will cause a runaway effect wherein artificial intelligence will
exceed human intellectual capacity and control, thus radically changing or even
ending civilization in an event called the singularity.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                        </span><span
class=GramE>“<a
href="http://www-rohan.sdsu.edu/faculty/vinge/misc/singularity.html">The Coming
Technological Singularity: How to Survive in the Post-Human Era</a>” (c)
1993 by <span class=SpellE>Vernor</span> <span class=SpellE>Vinge</span>.</span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:3'>                                    </span>(Verbatim
copying/translation and distribution of this entire article <span class=GramE>is</span>
permitted in any medium, provided this notice is preserved.)<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>    </span><o:p></o:p></span></h2>

<h2 style='margin-top:0in;margin-right:0in;margin-bottom:0in;margin-left:1.5in;
margin-bottom:.0001pt;text-indent:-1.5in'><span style='font-size:12.0pt;
font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:2'>                                                </span>“Abstract:<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>     </span>Within thirty years,
we will have the technological means to create superhuman intelligence. Shortly
after, the human era will be ended.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Is such progress avoidable? If not to be avoided, can events be guided
so that we may survive?<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>These
questions are investigated. Some possible answers (and some further dangers)
are presented.”<o:p></o:p></span></h2>

</span><span style='mso-tab-count:1'>            </span>Eric

itinerary it settles on does stay at a higher energy for a little bit until it
passes closest to Europa, maximizing the velocity before the insertion sequence
to the lower energy.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>This is indeed
optimal behavior, as opposed to immediately reducing its energy as a Greedy
Best First algorithm using this heuristic would want to do.” <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

href="http://www.boxcar2d.com/">Boxcar 2D</a>”<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>The
program learns to build a car using a genetic algorithm. <o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p style='margin:0in;margin-bottom:.0001pt'><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:
normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><span style='mso-tab-count:
3'>                                    </span>If
you let this program run for a long time (>> 30 generations), you will
see that eventually it produces cars well suited to the terrain. This outcome
illustrates a general theme of genetic algorithms: very, very slow; but,
eventually, good performance. After all, it took ~3.6 billion years to evolve humans
from bacteria (<a
href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life">http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Timeline_of_evolutionary_history_of_life</a>).
Please note that this eventual good performance of genetic algorithms is conditional
upon a representation that allows good solutions to sub-problems to be combined
simply, by cross-over, into a globally good solution; if the vector position of
the features is completely randomized within the chromosome, any such good
performance is lost.<o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/monster-sudoku-final-report-template_rev1_20160310.pdf">here</a>.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(1) A Java coding shell for Sudoku is available in case it may be helpful
to you as an example (<a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuProjectShell.zip">shell is here</a>).
I do not yet have C++ or Python shells (they will be written this quarter), and
it has never been tested by “live” use in a CS-171 class. In spite
of these limitations, we thought it might be helpful to you as an example.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(2) <span style='background:yellow;mso-highlight:yellow'>(<span
class=GramE>revised</span> 1 Mar 2016) The tester program has been removed
because it has been replaced by the grader program. Teams that deposit their
code in EEE <span class=SpellE>DropBox</span> by midnight, Friday, 4 March,
will have their code run through the grader program and be notified of any
errors by Saturday morning.</span> <s>(<span class=GramE>revised</span> 3 Feb
2016) Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Minhaeng</span> Lee, the
Reader, a test shell to validate your programs on openlab.ics.uci.edu is
available <a href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuTester_v0.2.zip1">here</a>.
This shell is only for testing whether student's program is runnable on the <span
class=SpellE>openlab</span> environment. <u>Please note that, currently, the
testing shell doesn't contain tests for whether or not the output is correct. We
will update it later.</u><o:p></o:p></s></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(3) Thanks to the good efforts of <span class=SpellE>Junkyu</span> Lee,
the TA, a detailed description of exactly what to turn in for your Sudoku
Project Assignments is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/SudokuProjectAssignments_20160209.pdf">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>It will be updated as we go along. <u>Please
note that we are still discussing what to do about the Generator portion of the
project, which was canceled because the provided Java shell included a
generator. However, apparently some students have written their own generator
anyway. Most likely we will give extra credit for extra work; but the matter is
still under discussion. In the meantime, it is OK if your program accepts the
GEN and BT option tokens.</u> If you wrote your own generator then exactly one
of the GEN and BT tokens must be present (one is required but they are mutually
exclusive), and they govern whether your program is being run in generate (GEN)
or solver (BT) mode. If you did not write your own generator then you may
ignore, but must tolerate, both the GEN and BT tokens. Please see the Sudoku
Project Assignments document described in this paragraph for more details.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(4) </span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>A slideshow
about the Monster Sudoku coding project is available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/monster-sudoku/aiproject-monster-sudoku.pptx">here</a>.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span></span><b><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";
mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'><o:p></o:p></span></b></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(5) </span><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";background:yellow;
mso-highlight:yellow'>Merged with Sudoku Project Assignments (above).</span><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'> </span><s><span style='font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:
minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'>A Specification for your Monster
Sudoku problem Reader and Generator is available here. It is largely superseded
because the provided Java shell already contains a Generator.</span></s><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";
mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:bold'><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif";mso-fareast-font-family:
"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast;mso-bidi-font-weight:
bold'>(6) Just for fun, once upon a time I wrote LISP code (available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/odometer.lisp.txt">here</a>) that
computes the "odometer" style tokens up to any arbitrarily large N
(example of the resulting tokens available <a
href="../../AI-projects/sudoku-solver/odometer-values.txt">here</a>).<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>Please note that this
"odometer" material is purely for cultural interest, i.e., you will
never be responsible for "odometer" style tokens above 35 on quizzes,
exams, or the project.<span style='mso-spacerun:yes'> 
</span>Nevertheless, it is a curious wrinkle that is interesting to see,
especially if you are interested in bigger and better.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";mso-fareast-theme-font:minor-fareast'>

x86 <span class=GramE>machine</span>. The OS is CentOS 6. We most likely will
need to compile your code with CentOS 6 (RHEL 6) x86_64. Machines in the
openlab.ics.uci.edu (family-guy.ics.uci.edu) are CentOS 6. Your code should run
on </span></b><a href="http://openlab.ics.uci.edu">openlab.ics.uci.edu</a>.<b><span

<h2><a name="_Study_Guides_---"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Study Guides --- Previous CS-171 Quizzes,
Mid-term, and Final exams:</span><span class=MsoHyperlink><span
style='font-size:12.0pt;mso-fareast-font-family:"Times New Roman";color:windowtext;
font-weight:normal;text-decoration:none;text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Previous
CS-171 Quizzes, Mid-term exams, and Final exams are available here as study
guides.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>As an
incentive to study this material, at least one question from a previous Quiz or
Exam will appear on every new Quiz or Exam. In particular, questions that many
students missed are likely to appear again. If you missed a question, please
study it carefully and learn from your mistake --- so that if it appears again,
you will understand it perfectly.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Please note
that some of the very old tests below reflect different textbooks that may
define some things differently than does your current textbook. In case of
conflict, your current textbook is deemed correct and will prevail. Some of
your visualization systems may not display the red PDF overlays used to correct
errors in very old tests. For example, in problems #2a, #2c, #3a, and #3b on
Quiz #2 from SQ’2004, the PDF overlay is invisible on a Mac (iPad), and
possibly on some other systems or printers.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>The PDF overlays just do not seem to
work as advertised (sorry!!), but this problem seems only to afflict very old
tests (i.e., from over a decade ago). If you are confused by any of the answers
below, please bring your questions to the TA in Discussion Section.<span
style='mso-spacerun:yes'>  </span>If you find a genuine error anywhere,
please send me email and you will receive a Bonus Point if correct.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Also, a
student has recommended ‘quizlet.com’ as a good online study
resource. While I cannot vouch for it, apparently it contains several good
study aids for your textbook.<o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p class=MsoNormal><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'><o:p> </o:p></span></p>

<h2><a name="_Academic_Honesty:"></a><span style='font-size:12.0pt;font-family:
"Arial","sans-serif";color:red'>Academic Honesty: </span><span
class=MsoHyperlink><span style='color:windowtext;text-decoration:none;
text-underline:none'><o:p></o:p></span></span></h2>

<p class=MsoNormal><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span
style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>Academic dishonesty is unacceptable
and will not be tolerated at the University of California, Irvine. It is the
responsibility of each student to be familiar with UCI's current academic
honesty policies. Please take the time to read the current <a
href="http://senate.uci.edu/uci-academic-senate-manual/part-iii-appendices-of-the-irvine-division/appendix-viii-uci-academic-senate-policy-on-academic-honesty/">UCI
Academic Senate Policy <span class=GramE>On</span> Academic Integrity</a> and
the <a href="https://www.ics.uci.edu/ugrad/policies/Academic_Honesty.php">ICS
School Policy on Academic Honesty</a>.</span></b></p>

<p><b style='mso-bidi-font-weight:normal'><span style='font-family:"Arial","sans-serif"'>The
policies in these documents will be adhered to scrupulously. Any student who
engages in cheating, forgery, dishonest conduct, plagiarism, or collusion in
dishonest activities, will receive an academic evaluation of ``F'' for the
entire course, with a letter of explanation to the student's permanent file.
The <a href="http://www.ics.uci.edu/grad/sao/index.php">ICS Student Affairs
Office</a> will be involved at every step of the process. Dr. Lathrop seeks to
create a level playing field for all students.</span></b></p>
